diff_hunk:
@@ -68,251 +68,7 @@ echo "$SWIG_PATH" > tensorflow/tools/swig/swig_path
 # Invoke python_config and set up symlinks to python includes
 (./util/python/python_config.sh --setup "$PYTHON_BIN_PATH";) || exit -1
 
-## Set up Cuda-related environment settings
-
-while [ "$TF_NEED_CUDA" == "" ]; do
body:
+Kristina Chodorow kchodorow@google.com to answer that question.

On Thu, Jul 28, 2016 at 11:04 AM David Z. Chen notifications@github.com
wrote:

> In configure
> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/3269#discussion_r72587457:
> 
> > @@ -68,251 +68,7 @@ echo "$SWIG_PATH" > tensorflow/tools/swig/swig_path
> >  # Invoke python_config and set up symlinks to python includes
> >  (./util/python/python_config.sh --setup "$PYTHON_BIN_PATH";) || exit -1
> > 
> > ## -## Set up Cuda-related environment settings
> > 
> > -while [ "$TF_NEED_CUDA" == "" ]; do
> 
> Working on fixing these two issues.
> 
> By the way, is there a reason why the fetch command doesn't create any
> Bazel output dir symlinks? Seems that it might be useful to create the
> bazel-<workspace-name> symlink at least so that we can look at the
> external repositories that were fetched.
> 
> —

body_html:
+Kristina Chodorow kchodorow@google.com to answer that question.

On Thu, Jul 28, 2016 at 11:04 AM David Z. Chen notifications@github.com
wrote:

In configure
#3269 (comment):

@@ -68,251 +68,7 @@ echo "$SWIG_PATH" > tensorflow/tools/swig/swig_path

Invoke python_config and set up symlinks to python includes

(./util/python/python_config.sh --setup "$PYTHON_BIN_PATH";) || exit -1

-## Set up Cuda-related environment settings

-while [ "$TF_NEED_CUDA" == "" ]; do

Working on fixing these two issues.

By the way, is there a reason why the fetch command doesn't create any
Bazel output dir symlinks? Seems that it might be useful to create the
bazel- symlink at least so that we can look at the
external repositories that were fetched.

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

body_text:
+Kristina Chodorow kchodorow@google.com to answer that question.
On Thu, Jul 28, 2016 at 11:04 AM David Z. Chen notifications@github.com
wrote:

In configure
#3269 (comment):

@@ -68,251 +68,7 @@ echo "$SWIG_PATH" > tensorflow/tools/swig/swig_path
Invoke python_config and set up symlinks to python includes
(./util/python/python_config.sh --setup "$PYTHON_BIN_PATH";) || exit -1
-## Set up Cuda-related environment settings
-while [ "$TF_NEED_CUDA" == "" ]; do

Working on fixing these two issues.
By the way, is there a reason why the fetch command doesn't create any
Bazel output dir symlinks? Seems that it might be useful to create the
bazel- symlink at least so that we can look at the
external repositories that were fetched.
—
